data.title: Ported MonoGame to use the new Xamarin iOS Unified API
data.body:
This is a port of MonoGame to the new Xamarin Unified API on iOS (http://developer.xamarin.com/guides/cross-platform/macios/unified/). The Classic API is a dead end on iOS, as Apple requires all apps to include a 64 bit binary, starting February 1, 2015 https://developer.apple.com/news/?id=10202014a

Protobuild doesn't support the unified api yet, so you'll have to modify the project files (MonoGame.Framework.iOS.csproj and MonoGame.Framework.Net.iOS.csproj) for now by hand. Change the ProjectTypeGuid from
 `6BC8ED88-2882-458C-8E55-DFD12B67127B` to `FEACFBD2-3405-455C-9665-78FE426C6842` 
and replace the occurence of 
`<Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\Xamarin\iOS\Xamarin.MonoTouch.CSharp.targets" />` or `<Import Project="$(MSBuildBinPath)\Microsoft.CSharp.targets" />` 
with
 `<Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\Xamarin\iOS\Xamarin.iOS.CSharp.targets" />`

These changes need to be done on the ThirdParty/Lidgren.Network/Lidgren.Network.iOS.csproj project file too, and you need to change `<Reference Include="monotouch" />` to `<Reference Include="Xamarin.iOS" />`

data.title: Rewrote content builder targets
data.body:
### What it does
1. Automatically builds MonoGame Content projects before the project is built
2. Builds incrementally to allow faster development
3. Supports multiple projects in the same directory (like resolution packs), whitespaces in paths (like the Visual Studio 2013 folder)
4. Outputs built content to `ProjectDirectory\Content\PlatformName` (avoiding clash of contents built for different platforms)
5. Content files will be added to the project and copied to the output directory
6. Content files will be automatically packaged with the rest of the app (including Android)

TL;DL
Works as seamlessly as XNA content pipeline
### How to get it to work

Add the following lines to the csproj file using a text editor:
#### At the end of the first `<PropertyGroup>`:

``` XML
<MonoGamePlatform>PlatformName</MonoGamePlatform>
```

(PlatformName shuold be iOS, Android, WindowsPhone, etc)
#### Somewhere after an `</ItemGroup>`:

``` XML
  <ItemGroup>
    <MonoGameContentReference Include="PathToYour.mgcb">
    </MonoGameContentReference>
  </ItemGroup>
```
#### At the end of the file, before `</Project>`

``` XML
  <Import Project="PathTo\MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets" />
```

Thanks to @jamesford42 and @tomspilman for the help.

data.title: Gamepad support for Android
data.body: This pull request adds gamepad support for Android devices. It is based on the Ouya's implementation, and @infspacestudios advices. I tested the code in my Nexus 5 with two types of gamepads and it's working well. Feel free to review my work.

data.title: Fixed default values in FontTextureProcessor
data.body:
While there is a DefaultValueAttribute for these, it is not actually set.
This was a problem for the import option in the pipeline tool. SpriteFonts have PremultiplyAlpha=true by default and it is not present in the XML. When it gets imported, PremultiplyAlpha gets set to the default value, which was incorrectly false. The generated mgcb files will have incorrect default values. In case of PremultiplyAlpha, it results in messed up textures.

data.title: Only compress font textures if asked to
ResolveRelativePath fixes for iOS
data.body: Previous PR #3093 was buggy because it was sometimes passing 4 consecutive slashes to the Uri ctor ("file:////...").

data.title: Content pipeline texture fonts fixed
Added support for BGRA444 and BGR565 in PixelBitmapContent
data.body:
The fix was pretty straightfoward, once I figured out what needs to be fixed. Probably we should add more types as PixelBitmapContent is supposed to support all pixel types.

Fixes #3089

data.title: [Content Pipeline] Texture font line spacing is 0
data.body: The title says it all :)

data.title: [Content Pipeline] Space as starting character not supported
data.body: Currently the content processor doesn't recognize space as a starting charater and acts like it wasn't provided.

data.title: [Content Pipeline] Font textures not processed correctly
data.body:
Glyph.CharacterWidths is not set by FontTextureProcessor (character kernings stay 0), which results in all characters drawn on top of eachother.
![screenshot_10282014_172755](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/431167/4812268/67711f9a-5ebf-11e4-9a93-44c0c5f5861b.png)

data.title: What is a IsContentLost properties ?
data.body:
Several classes have it, including most important GraphicsDevice. They just return false or dublicates IsDisposed, so at this time it is a garbage.

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=IsContentLost

If you like I can delete it in my next pull request.

Also I found strange ResourcesLost property in GraphicsDevice...

data.title: Proposal: Add new SpriteEffects.Rotate90
data.body:
Most texture packers allow the option of rotating sprites to make the most efficient use of space.

I'd like to add a `SpriteEffects.Rotate90` option where `SpriteBatch.Draw` handles the grunt work with a simple transpose / translate.

**Goals:**
- (Nearly?) zero performance impact when `SpriteEffects.Rotate90` **is not** referenced.
- Minimal performance impact when `SpriteEffects.Rotate90` **is** referenced.
- Plays nice with existing enums - able to add a `SpriteEffects.Rotate270` as `FlipHorizontally | FlipVertically | Rotate90`
- Add unit tests for non-XNA platforms.
- If appropriate, add additional `SpriteBatch.Draw(...)` overload(s) that make using SpriteEffects easier when other options aren't needed.

Thoughts / concerns?

data.title: Proposal: Provide Protobuild packages for MonoGame
data.body:
Over the past few weeks I've been working on a feature in Protobuild to provide binary packages as a swappable alternative to Git submodules.  The aim of this feature is to reduce clone times and download usages.  This issue covers both packaging third party dependencies internally for MonoGame, and packaging MonoGame itself.

**Dependencies Repository within MonoGame**

Currently the MonoGame.Dependencies repository is 117.31Mb to clone, and this happens every time you clone a new copy of MonoGame.  If you're using Git submodules in your project, that means you're taking this download hit every time you clone on a build server or otherwise cloning a copy of your game (you can work around this with some Git magic + cloning for build servers, but it's particularly susceptible to race conditions and doesn't solve it in the general case).

The MonoGame repository itself is 45.67Mb; if you include all of the submodules that are cloned when doing `git submodule update --init --recursive`, then the total initial clone size is 198.89Mb (Kickstart is 35.91Mb).

Using some naive reference calculations (looking at the definition files to determine what references the runtime + content pipeline uses on each platform), the equivalent binary package for each platform for the MonoGame.Dependencies repository would be:
- Linux:
  - Runtime: 1.3Mb (lzma)
  - Content Pipeline: 21.9Mb (lzma)
- Windows:
  - Runtime: 2.1Mb (lzma)
  - Content Pipeline: 29.6Mb (lzma)
- iOS:
  - Runtime: Apparently there are none according to definition files?  This doesn't sound right
- Android:
  - Runtime: 330Kb (lzma)

I haven't measured the other platforms, but I expected a similar pattern to emerge.  Most of the framework runtime dependencies are reasonably small, while most of the file size bloat for the Content Pipeline comes from the inclusion of ffmpeg / ffprobe (only one of which appears to be used for the video content compilation).

We can apply the same logic here with the Kickstart repository.  This would save us downloading Kickstart at all if the developer isn't generating projects for Linux / Mac OS (although the MonoGame build server would download a binary package for this since it builds for all platforms).

**EDIT:** I'm now in the process of updating Protobuild to use LZMA compression for packages instead of GZip.

**MonoGame itself**

Packaging MonoGame itself would offer a new way of obtaining MonoGame binaries for various platforms.  Primarily this would assist with people who use MonoGame as a library, either as a Git submodule or by depending on users running the installer.  The users of the former setup would save significant download and build time and the latter could simplify usage of their library / game as people wanting to build code no longer need to install MonoGame explicitly.

_Future benefits (i.e. functionality that is planned for Protobuild, but not yet implemented):_

Protobuild is designed to support swapping out binary for source code and vice-versa.  This means when using the Protobuild package with a binary version, users only need to run `Protobuild.exe --swap MonoGame` in order to swap out the binaries for a Git submodule.  This would make it significantly easier to debug issues within MonoGame if users run into it; certainly easier than any mechanism NuGet provides, or usage of binaries through the installer.

This is also a pretext to supporting project templates in Protobuild itself.  These would allow users to create new projects through the Protobuild executable, via template packages in the Protobuild index.  Either by doing `Protobuild.exe --create MonoGame/Platformer2D` or by using the GUI that opens when there is no module in the current directory.

data.title: Desired: Exception when VertexDeclaration stride does not match template parameter size in DrawUser(Indexed)Primitives
data.body:
In XNA, when you use a VertexDeclaration whose stride is smaller than the size of the vertex data type supplied to DrawUserIndexedPrimitives (the IVertexType template parameter), an exception is thrown. However, there's no exception in MonoGame, making errors more difficult to debug. It should be pretty easy to add an exception to catch this early rather than digging through lots of lower-level code to figure out why you crashed.

Thanks!

data.title: Fixed null reference exception in Guide on Windows 8
data.body: CoreWindow.GetForCurrentThread() is null when not called on the main thread, which results in a null reference exception when trying to get the dispatcher. Using `CoreApplication.MainView.CoreWindow.Dispatcher;` instead resolves this problem as it works when called from any thread.

data.title: Pipeline Tool feature request: 'open output file location'
data.body:
Example usage:
Right click on content item
Rebuild
Right click on content item
Open Output-File Location

Note:
There is no need to have an 'Open Output-File' option since the output file is an xnb, and while an xnb visualizer would be cool, there isn't one.

Note:
When right click is on the project itself, this option takes you to the root of the output directory.

data.title: Pipeline Tool's File > Open Recent item enabled when zero items
data.body: File > Open Recent should be disabled if there are no items within it

data.title: [WinDX] 16 bit textures are not read correctly
data.body:
When reading content processed by XNA pipeline (and probably also MonoGame pipeline) 16 bit textures look like this on Windows DX:
![wp_ss_20141016_0001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/431167/4656092/ef4928da-54cf-11e4-9101-73b300a6bbf3.jpg)

Instead of this:
![splash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/431167/4661257/648deabc-5521-11e4-85ab-ad520fe27091.png)

This is the same as the one I observed in #3089 (where content processed by MGCB was not read correctly), hence I used the same pictures here for demonstration.

data.title: [WinStore] Add check at LoadFromStream method of Texture2D
data.body:
WIC does not support non-seekable streams.

For example when you load images from the web an exception is thrown by
DX but it's not very helpful to identify the problem.

http://sharpdx.org/forum/5-api-usage/379-sharpdx-wic-bitmapdecoder-class-not-working-with-outside-url

data.title: Conversion of MonoMacGameView to OpenTK equivalent.
data.body:
OpenTK for `MONOMAC` platform. Now MacOS is a peer to `WINDOWS` and `LINUX` platforms. Common code for desktop platforms.

I think it's ready for review / testing. RE: #2154.

**NOTES:**
- OpenTK controller mappings can replace SDL on other desktop platforms. Didn't consider that in scope for this PR.
- Media / Video needs some love. I need to compare how the other desktop platforms interface to `GameWindow` and try to emulate.
- Three intentional `#warning DISABLED DURING MONOMAC OPENTK CONVERSION` messages were added.
  - One in `OpenTKGameWindow.cs` to bypass icon extraction from assembly
  - One in `MacOS/GamerServices/Guide.cs` for `Window.ClearKeyCacheState()` which may not be needed now that we're using a different game loop.
  - One in `Media/VideoPlayer.MacOS.cs` for `_game.Window.AddSubview(_currentVideo.MovieView);`. That's the one that need some love.

data.title: Greatly improved Vector2
data.body:
Greatly improved Vector2. Test Included !

-all things now sorted within a regions
-comments for all things
-bugfixes
-added missing methods
-Test(where methods went through XNA compatibility)

data.title: Update tutorials.md
data.body: Added my tutorial for Resolution Independent Rendering with 2D camera in Monogame

data.title: iOS 8: Handling of portrait and hybrid portrait/landscape
data.body: I believe this fixes #3040 as well as also correctly supports Portrait-only applications.

data.title: [WP8] Do not reload .XNBs of types we don't need to reload
data.body:
Some types don't need to get reloaded, like for example SoundEffects. By
excluding those from ReloadAsset() we can speedup resuming.

Things to consider:
-SoundEffect is the only type I use in my active project that doesn't
contain GPU resources. Other types can be added to the list.
-Make the HashSet publicly accessible so users can add their own types.
-Instead of an Exclusion Set we can use an Inclusion Set  (Texture2D,
Texture3D, Cube, Model, etc)

data.title: graphicsdevicemanager.disposed not implemented
data.body:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphicsdevicemanager.disposed.aspx

Is not implemented

Its not a major part of our code but we have found that logging Device and DeviceManager events into our debugging logs really can help detect issues when you release on PC - there's so many things that can go wrong that clues like these events firing can help

data.title: WinRT / WP8.1 Exit question
data.body:
Hi!

I'm getting an error when compiling for WP8.1 when using "Exit"

"This platform's policy does not allow programmatically closing."

As far as I know, that requirement (3.6) was removed some time ago, but I'm not absolutely sure there's no other added requirement that forces EXit not to be used (I haven't found any in the certification requirements).

Does anybody knows this for sure?

thanks,
Kak

data.title: Disable dithering on OpenGL(ES) platforms
data.body:
With OpenGL/OpenGLES, dithering is enabled by default and it is up to the driver to decide when/how to apply dithering which can give unexpected results. For example, pixel data retrieved using `RenderTarget2D.GetData` can be slightly different than expected due to the nature of dithering.

This issue seem to mainly affect Mali T400 devices (most Galaxy S2, Galaxy Tab3, Galaxy Note).

Disabling dithering by default might result in more banding if the backbuffer/rendertaget is 16bit but at least it will be deterministic (performances might be better as well). AFAIK, XNA 4.0 doesn't expose a way to enable/disable dithering (DirectX 10 deprecated support for automatic dithering) so I am not sure if it was up to the Windows Phone device vendor to enable it or not.

We could disable dithering in the `GraphicsDevice` initialization to avoid redundant state changes but I added it to the RasterizerState to make sure it is disabled even if third party code re-enables it. The RasterizerState code do need some caching anyway, we should do this as a separate PR.

data.title: Hooks into ViewController
data.body: I needed to add hooks into ViewDidAppear and ViewDidDisappear in the iOSGameViewController in order to use Flurry's ads. I created an interface for dependency injections.

data.title: Feature Request: Hooks into ViewController
data.body:
Hello,

I needed to add hooks into ViewDidAppear and ViewDidDisappear in the iOSGameViewController in order to use Flurry's ads.  I created an interface for dependency injections.  Is there a better way to do this?  Is this enough for a pull request?  Or are there any changes that you would recommend?

Here's the branch I created:  https://github.com/nikhilsinha/MonoGame

Here's the commit for the interface: https://github.com/nikhilsinha/MonoGame/commit/8b4fd5f59b7d6b52fe7c36b826ca64056ad2a469

Here's the commit for the hooks in the code:
https://github.com/nikhilsinha/MonoGame/commit/17a298285f2f204c11bf097b8fd5f96c0e130ccd
